title: I don't care if you are salty
body:
+Just pull your pants up and finish the game, wanker

+Learn to appreciate tolerance...

+You are the deity in _your_ life, you can only control what **YOU** do.

-Most people think to blame and blame and blame, it's a problem and everyone can see it but nothing is being done

+Because nothing can be done, unless you start with yourself.

-People afk you say, they do it because every other troll who lived does stuff like this

+Don't feed the flames excusing your behaviour with "the fire was already there"

+Because if nobody fed the flames then the fire would snuffle out

+And then everyone can actually appreciate each other and get on with life

_A general message to any and all asshats who are arrogant enough to think they get to leave a game to escape their problems_

> [{quoted}](name=Garens Harem,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=HXFKX6OL,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-13T12:30:57.584+0000)
>
> i leave games cause my dota match was starting soon

if I could link you the first 3 words in my title then I would
The sodium chloride is strong with this one.
I like magnesium chloride more, the ionic compound for that salt is so much nicer to look at

I'm a fan of Francium Fluoride, they contain the two elements I like, and it's never been made before, but in theory it should only be radioactive and not chemically reactive while it becomes full of FUN when put through electrolysis!
Gonna need a vacuum of air to do that, francium will react with the air, not that easy to mix otherwise. Francium also has a relatively short half life.

_relatively?_ It has the shortest half life of a fraction of a second on it's most stable isotope, and there's only a few grams of pure Francium on earth on any given moment.

It's pretty much radioactive salt, with similar chemical (but not radioactive) properties as Potassium Chloride which is table salt, which follows the general halogen+Alkali metal pattern, except it'll dissolve slower.

When put through electrolysis, the Francium will blow up the water solution and spread radiation (which it already did while bonded with Fluorine, but still), and the Fluorine will set the stuff around it on fire (Even metal).
lets just leave it as "would be a fun experiment to conduct, if we could"

But not now and likely not ever

Edit: we are influenced by the environment we are in, league is unhealthily competitive and promotes hate in players who think they deserve better then what they are capable of doing. More importantly, balancing of power is eerily simular to what you would find in the dynamic of bullies. **This does not apply to real life in general **

> [{quoted}](name=Chicken4dinner,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=HXFKX6OL,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-06-13T12:49:28.783+0000)
>
> Explain nature in general, then if you can link hatred to ours i'll believe you


If you want evidence of humans being hateful creatures by nature just look at all of human history ever

The same could be said for the opposite argument.. if humans are hateful by nature, why are there also humans beings who do not prefer kill, cause pain and grief to other human beings? Why have we left behind slavery? In places where we haven't, why are we strongly against it? Why are we moving away from racial and other forms discrimination? Why is there such thing as empathy? Why are we able to care about the well-being of species other than our own? We're certainly capable of committing acts out of hate.. and so are other intelligent animals, but hatefulness is not central to us.

because attempting to differentiate from what is common by putting down strict rules and a code of honour is also part of human nature. It's the stuff that causes rebellions simply because "the rulers sucked", and when the rebels finally build a castle out of their allies corpses to start a new law system which becomes commonly followed, another rebellion against the rebels starts up.
what is the meaning of life
Blame the media, we only see things meant to shock us for money
quality rekt.

So.. does it make you a happy and healthy person to want to hate other people? All it takes is common sense to realise this is complete rubbish. The only thing core about hatred in our "human nature" is that it's an emotion and the only thing that doesn't change is the fact things always change.

This view pisses me off.

Why should I continue to take part in a leisure activity when it ceases to be entertaining? If you stay in a boring game at the behest of your retarded twelve year old teammates then you're the one who isn't in control of your life. If I want to close league of legends, shut down my computer and go to the gym how are you going to stop me? lol, pathetic nerds.

What was meant by "you are the deity in your life", etc. or however else you feel like putting that piece of wisdom is that nobody can change your mind. No other person can get into your mind and make a decision for you; that is always, ultimately, "in your control". The closest another person can come to controlling you this way is emotional manipulation and it's not the same as having control over you.
